document_info.title: EU AI Act - Prohibited AI Practices (Article 5)

prohibited_practices.description: AI systems deploying subliminal techniques or manipulative/deceptive techniques to materially distort behavior causing significant harm
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.description: AI systems exploiting vulnerabilities due to age, disability, or social/economic situation
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.description: AI systems for social scoring leading to detrimental treatment
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.description: AI systems predicting criminality based solely on profiling
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.description: Creating facial recognition databases through untargeted scraping
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.description: AI systems inferring emotions in workplace/educational settings (except medical/safety)
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.description: AI systems categorizing persons by biometrics to infer protected characteristics
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover

prohibited_practices.category: Real-Time Biometric ID in Public Spaces
prohibited_practices.description: Real-time remote biometric identification in public spaces for law enforcement (with narrow exceptions)
prohibited_practices.penalties: Up to EUR 35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover
